citeinfo.title: Projected row crop proportions under climate change used in developing wetland density projections
Projected wetland densities under climate change: habitat loss but little geographic shift in conservation strategy

descript.abstract: The impact of climate change on land conversion was assessed by projecting the land-use model under GCM hindcast and forecast climatic conditions. For each GCM, we projected future row crop proportions under 40 years of average hindcast conditions (i.e., assuming historical climate prevails into the future), and under 20 year of average hindcast conditions followed by 20 years of average forecast conditions. We used twenty years of forecast conditions to avoid assuming that climate changes projected for mid-century would have occurred immediately. The 20-20 assumption approximates a linear transition from the historic to future climate and is not limiting since the probabilities will converge given sufficient years under a given climate regime. Projected climate change impacts differed in direction and spatial pattern between GCMs (Fig. S3). Projected changes in the proportion of the landscape planted in row crops were generally small (mean change = 0.01), but included increases of over 0.25 of the landscape and declines of over 0.3 of the landscape (Fig. S3). Conversion probabilities responded to precipitation as expected, with an increase in precipitation associated with higher probabilities that grass converts to crops and lower probabilities that crops convert to grass.
descript.purpose: Projections used to evaluate how altered land use in response to climate change could affect wetland densities in the Prairie Pothole Region.

attracc.attraccr: Quality control identified cells in the Cropland Database Layer with transitions likely to represent processing errors; these cells were excluded from the pool from which a random sample was drawn for modeling the processes affecting land use transitions.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

srcinfo.srccontr: Source information used in support of the development of the data set.

citeinfo.title: Climate Projections

procstep.procdesc: For each GCM, we projected future row crop proportions under 40 years of average hindcast conditions (i.e., assuming historical climate prevails into the future), and under 20 year of average hindcast conditions followed by 20 years of average forecast conditions. We used twenty years of forecast conditions to avoid assuming that climate changes projected for mid-century would have occurred immediately.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attrdomv.udom: This column added by default by write.csv in R
Concatenation of Statrum, Transect, and Segment in USFWS Waterfowl Breeding Population and Habitat Survey (Traditional Strata only)
Name of each of the 10 climate models used to develop land use projections under climate change

attr.attrdef: Time period for projections of row crop proportions

edom.edomvd: These projections were based on 20 yrs of mean conditions from the GCM historical simulation followed by 20 yrs of mean conditions in the future simulation (20H20F).
These projections were based on 40 yrs of mean conditions from the hindcast simulation (40H0F).

attr.attrdef: Projected proportion of row crops in survey area for each USFWS Waterfowl Breeding Population and Habitat Survey segment under each climate scenario.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
